intro: Lucinaea pentacme, commonly known as five-lobed wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Oxalidaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with three heart-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Lucinaea pentacme has a fibrous root system and is known for its ability to thrive in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
